channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023080584
item.description:
Report X-2023080584

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the outer packaging looked wet, On inspection found that one of the plastic bottles had a loose cap causing the spill. used appropriate PPE and absorbent pads to contain any further leakage. DescribePack: Loose Cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Place in a plastic salvage drum and used absorbent pads to to prevent spills.

Report X-2023080619

  • City: BINGHAMTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was found in the unload where it was wet on the side, I put it on a cart and brought it over to the hazmat cage and put in in the fumes hud. DescribePack: All four jugs had melted seals underneath the caps which caused them to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought it over to the hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hub.

item.title: Report X-2023080563
item.description:
Report X-2023080563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: BOHEMIA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded from the inbound trailer and it was noticed that the box was wet. The package was brought to the Hazmat cage where it was put inside a plastic bag and left for QA to inspect. DescribePack: The cap on 1 of the jugs was loose and some of the contents leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was brought to the Hazmat cage and put in a plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2023080520
item.description:
Report X-2023080520

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort, there was a jam on the NC belt, when a package handler went to clear the jammed package, this package hit against that one and fell off the belt crashing onto the floor. A manager came over and notified a hazmat team member that cleaned up the spill and placed it inside a yellow hazmat drum and put it under ventilation in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the glass bottles was shattered as it fell when it impacted the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was cleaned up with hazmat absorbent powder and then placed in a yellow hazmat drum and placed in the hazmat cage under ventilation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found in unload with a wet spot on the box which had a hole through the box as well. After I found it, I brought it over to hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud. DescribePack: One of the jugs had a seal that failed and the lid was not tight on the jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought it over to the hazmat cage upon finding it.

item.title: Report I-2023070018
item.description:
Report I-2023070018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: ORISKANY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HILLTOP ENERGY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/24/2023 while on a return trip from Heidelberg Materials in Jordanville, O'brien Brickey was traveling west on Rt. 5S toward Utica. As he crossed over a bridge he noticed material white in color coming out of the back of the truck (270). O'Brien pulled over immediately to check out the truck upon doing so noticed there was emulsion flowing out from what appeared to be several places. O'Brien immediately called his supervisor Derrick Paro who instructed him to call PERS and also NY DEC was notified. O'Brien was told by PERS that appropriate personnel would be dispatched for cleanup. The site was cleaned up and there is nothing further at this time.
